p: IL-1β and IL-4 levels were increased following addition of N. sativa seed aqueous extract (1 and 2 µg/mL) to culture medium of non-activated peripheral blood mononuclear cells (PBMC) and allogeneic cells. Whole N. sativa proteins (0.1, 1 or 10 µg/mL) suppressed the production of IL-8 in non-stimulated as well as pokeweed mitogen-activated PBMC cells. Whole soluble N. sativa seed extract (2 µg/mL) also increased TNF-α production. Furthermore, fractionated extract of N. sativa was less effective than whole N. sativa proteins (Haq et al. 1999).
